comments.commentBody: You so called progressives have no guts. You behave like spoiled children when you don't get what you want now. President Obama will not extend tax cuts for the rich, won't happen. So, yes, shut up for now, prevent the baggers from getting anywhere close to power. And I have to tell you progressives, people of my persuasion, have a little patience for once. We are in the midst of an important election. You need to pull for the side that most matches your goals, not all, most, and needle them after we've vanquished the baggers. Believe me, you'd never get the time of day if baggers were in office.
Cjm will now explain exactly how the American Economy was destroyed in 20 months. Cmj, please, the thread is yours :
Write or call your Senator.  Do. it.  I just did.  This is f'ing redunkulous.
Drastically cutting the military would balance the budget AND allow further tax cuts. Why has no one the guts to propose this?

You poor, deluded guys. I almost feel sorry for you. Check this out:

http://hotlineoncall.nationaljournal.com....php

A more courageous Harry dropped the bomb when he thought it was right. Later he integrated our armed forces, in the face of the Southern generals and senators who  opposed that idea. Our modern-day Harry, refuses to face the Tea Party Republicans, who for whatever reason want to protect the top income earners in this country. Lame duck congress hell, lame-duck Harry hell.

Oy gevalt.  At the very very very least, why wouldn't the Democrats think of introducing a bill preserving the Cheney-Bush tax cuts for everyone except those with incomes over $1,000,000?  I would even watch the Sunday-morning talk shows to see McConnell and Boehner tie themselves up in knots defending a filibuster of such a bill.  The question is not, What is Harry Reid thinking?, rather, IS Harry Reid thinking?

Apparently some alleged liberal posters don't understand the "divide and conquer" concept. Cut out the cancer then address the thyroid issue.

It is really quite simple unless you don't know which one of the Twins is the cancer.

Hoyer and  his buddies squandered a trillion dollars in porkulus money, and now want to crow about a bill that is months late and hundreds of billions short?  Tell us, Stenky, how effective it was to save 7.5 jobs by spending $111 million in LA.  Or what the taxpayers get from $120,000 round trips to SF so Pelosi can visit her $18,000 a month office.  Or paying for a fundraising trip to the middle east for Imam Rauf.  Tell us all Stenky, how much better off mainstreet is for these and other similar expenditures.  And while you're at it , explain exactly how it is and how much HCR will "save".  Before you take too many potshots at anyone else, you have plenty  to answer for for yourself.

What could he have possibly called them:
Bigots? No.
Simpletons? Not salty enough.
Mob Proles? Huh uh.
Crypto-fascists? What?!?

I think President Obama has finally figured out that out-of-control liberal spending (first under Bush and now on fire under Dems), reckless bailouts and tax increases are not a change we can believe in.  I know you all don't believe this so answer me this.  Why is his entire economic staff being canned or quitting?  Failure anyone?  Stalling tax increases won't stem the revolution that is coming this November.  Get ready liberals on both sides of the aisle, your time is up.

So we're angry... obviously. We're also disappointed and discouraged. THAT's what the republicans are counting on. If the final nail in our country's coffin is coming in November, though, it will be because WE shrunk away in the face of adversity and didn't vote. It is the VOTING habits of the American people that have eroded the spines of the democrats. They haven't got OUR backs because, election after election, we don't cover THEIRS! Election turnout in the natural districts and constituencies for liberal/progressive support is abyssmal, percentage-wise.
John Roberts and his henchmen may have given corporations carte blanche, but of ALL things they can't do (yet) is actually buy votes. We know the ads they pay for aren't true. We know they have a vested interest in seeing that "THEIR" candidates win. We can even see that when they get their candidates elected, it will eventually follow that they'll have the courts in their pockets. STILL, their money can't buy votes.
It is DISCOURAGEMENT that they are intentionally creating with their money. The MORE they are seen to spend, the more they believe the American people will feel overwhelmed, helpless and discouraged. They are not trying to buy our votes with their limitless money. They aren't trying to convince us (those of us with brains, anyway) that their lapdogs are the best choice.
What they are doing is simply discouraging us... making us feel weak and helpless... because they KNOW FROM EXPERIENCE... if they are successful at disouraging enough people into not voting, they will win the battle by DEFAULT... it's their only hope. In the future, if their strategy holds true, and they continue to leverage the minority into a majority role, eventually, they may not have to worry about pesky little details like "elections". Then, even I will start to be discouraged.
Pardon my RANT!

To me it sounds like Newt Gingrich all over again.
Remember Newt's Contract on, or make that , with , America?
What did it get us? Not much, and negligible.
Let's not get ourselves lost in this Republican challenge.
The Democrats can get us out of the last administration's spending and tax cutting sooner than anyone, especially that by the Republicans.
It's imperative to keep the Democrats and get on with restoring the Republic. Rome was not built in a day and two years does not make an administration.
The Republicans are playing their cards. A re-hash of Newt Gingrich and come 2012 and the Campaign 4 America, they'll try a Jimmy Carter attack. We've got to make sure that these next two general elections are not a Jimmy Carter Re-dux, but Jimmy Carter's revenge.

To waiting from anywhere (comment #61)...what a load of crap.  If the left were sheep, like the right is/are, we would just believe what our leaders tell us, like you guys did for 8 years under Bush, instead of justifiably critizing them...like we are doing.  We will never go along with something just because we are told to...like the conservatives always do.

Why all this venom directed at Senator Reid and the Democratic leadership? It is obvious to me that they simply didn't have the votes to override another Republican filibuster.

Alan Kimmel
Chicago, Illinois
Peter poster #6, your outrage would be sexier if your side didn't do it continuously.

Oh yeah? Takes one to know one....She acts like a child and wants to be a leader. How pathetic.

Socrates was correct-the only people worthy of holding power are those not seeking it.

Our pool of "leadership" is horrible.

There is nothing going to be done after the election. Its will be played, "as the will of the people", after the elections. If majorities are gained by Republicans we must wait till the "NEW" Congress is sworn in. That has already been floated earlier this year.
The will of the people...what a joke.
Can't wait for the "Special Prosecutors" of Darrell Issa to investigate the home buying of Pres. Obama.
Wait till the Salahis are called to tesify about the "wrong" doings they witnessed when they "crashed" the State Dinner.
Obama is "Mikey" from the movie "Swingers", waiting for the Republicans to call. "Your so Money, and you don't even know it". Yeah,.... maybe 18 months ago.

In response to Peter from NY (6):  There is the matter of which generalizations ("distortions" if you will) are true and which are false.  Michele's Obama's comment was truly restricted to the context in which she was saying that "for the first time [she was] proud of America", namely the racial progress that her husband's candidacy represented.   In Boehner's case, from everything he and the Republicans have been pursuing as a matter of fact, the return to the pain and destruction of 2000 - 2008 is not restricted to social issues but also to economic and military policies which have been a proven disaster except for the very rich.  Sometimes you have to consider the facts and not merely the formal parts of the arguments.

The congressional GOP has suffered serious losses in two consecutive election cycles. I don't think its position on "social issues" - which really boils down to opposition to abortion and gay rights - is resonating with the voters.
Here's the way the Senate works: if the Democrats don't have 60 votes to override a Republican filibuster, it makes no difference how courageous they are. You lose.

What makes anyone think that the average voter is going to "get it"? They don't read very much (certainly not the NYT), and we definitely don't expect Faux News to emphasize the Orange Man's statement.  For those of us who knew the score already, this isn't really news.

Gee--one can only wonder what would have popped out of Tanboy's piehole is they'd held that...um...news conference later in the day--closer to "happy" hour.

Though friends of mine who work in Congress tell me the time of day isn't relevant--the wannabe Speaker apparently believes in the restorative properties of the morning "eye-opener."

Or two.
In my original comment, I failed to mention that Mr. Redfern's salty language is in the fine tradition of former VP Dick Cheney.

THIRD PARTY ANYONE? Haven't you had enough yet? Still hoping they will finally come through for you? America-stop being the abused spouse to the bully husband that is your poitical party.

I think think the Dems are wimpy milktoasts. and the Repubs are hateful and insane. Not a good dynamic.
